Literature Information.Literature: Discovery:  identified from Transcriptome via sequence alignment followed by AI prediction using online tools.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 53.85% similar toinsect Macropin 1L: 23%, S=K: 15%.Activity: Active against E. coli (MBC 35 uM), S-aureus (MBC >70 uM). Warning: other bacteria not tested.In vitro toxicity: human RBC: not hemo.lytic at 140 uM.MOA:bacteria:E. coli: SEM showed cell surface damage, likely acting on membranes.Structure:  helical structure is confirmed in 30% TFE by CD.
Literature Information.Author: Córdoba L, López D, Mejía M, Guzmán F, Beltrán D, Carbonell B, Medina L. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Antibacterial Activity of AXOTL-13, a Novel Peptide Identified from the Transcriptome of the Salamander Ambystoma mexicanum.
